meanings.definition: In a manner that cannot be defeated or annulled
meanings.sent1: She held onto her dream indefeasibly, never letting anyone discourage her.
meanings.sent2: The contract was written indefeasibly, ensuring no loopholes could be exploited.
meanings.sent3: The cat clung indefeasibly to the top of the tree, refusing to come down.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as indefeasibly strong as a steel chain, unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The sun rose indefeasibly every morning, a constant in the ever-changing sky.

meanings.definition: In a way that is not subject to being lost or voided
meanings.sent1: The memories of her childhood were indefeasibly etched in her mind.
meanings.sent2: The ownership of the property was indefeasibly transferred to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The cake stood indefeasibly on the table, tempting everyone with its sweetness.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was indefeasibly strong, unwavering through all challenges.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood indefeasibly against the test of time, a testament to their enduring strength.
